Sentencas: Herein a chemical reduction method is proposed in order to modify the solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) traditional cathode material La0.8Sr0.2MnO3-x (LSM).
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of silver-modified La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode powders for solid oxide fuel cells by chemical reduction method

Sentencas: Silver nanoparticles were prepared by the reduction of ammoniacal silver nitrate with ascorbic acid in dilute aqueous solutions containing PVP.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of silver-modified La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode powders for solid oxide fuel cells by chemical reduction method

Sentencas: The obtained LSM-Ag composite powders were characterized by XRD, SEM, EDX, and STEM.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of silver-modified La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode powders for solid oxide fuel cells by chemical reduction method

Sentencas: The results showed that the LSM-Ag composite powder possess an elaborated fine structure with a homogeneous distribution of Ag and LSM, which effectively shortens the diffusion pathway for electrons and adsorbed oxygen.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of silver-modified La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode powders for solid oxide fuel cells by chemical reduction method

Sentencas: The electrochemical performance of the LSM Ag cathode with different Ag loadings was investigated.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of silver-modified La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode powders for solid oxide fuel cells by chemical reduction method

Sentencas: A cathode loading with 1 wt.% Ag exhibited an area specific resistance as low as 0.45 Omega cm(2) at 750 degrees C, compared to around 1.1 Omega cm(2) for a pure LSM electrode.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of silver-modified La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode powders for solid oxide fuel cells by chemical reduction method

Sentencas: Similarly an anode-supported SOFC with 1 wt.% Ag in the cathode shows a peak power density of 1199 mW cm(-1), higher than the value of 717 mW cm(-1) achieved for a similar cell with a LSM cathode.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of silver-modified La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode powders for solid oxide fuel cells by chemical reduction method

Sentencas: Increasing the Ag loading is shown to have an insignificant effect on improving electrocatalytic performance at 750 degrees C, however it can increase output power at 650 degrees
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of silver-modified La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode powders for solid oxide fuel cells by chemical reduction method
